there are apparently no javadocs at all. we really need a comprehensive overview
of all the supported attributes...
creator: nettings@apache.org

text:
specifically, it sometimes seems to get ssl wrong (might be causing the sitetree
woes with proxying setups...). my current url is a https://... one and still {proxy:
creator: nettings@apache.org

text:
Are you referring to the ProxyModule in the linking module? It contains some javadocs at class level: /** * Input module for getting the base URL which may be prepended to internal URLs * to construct links. The functionality corresponds to the * {@link org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.transformation.ProxyTransformer} with one * exception: If the webappUrl parameter is an empty string, the root * proxy URL (or the context prefix, resp.) is returned. * *

* Usage: {proxy:{webappUrl}} *

*/
creator: andreas@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
ah well, i was under the impression that the proxy input module had some extra
flags for ssl or relative/absolute links... turns out it only takes a plain url
string, which is sufficiently self-documenting :-D
